intro: Brassicella erucastrum var. leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender leafed mustard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, pinnately divided leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in racemes, producing small, round pods that contain several seeds. This variety is characterized by its compact growth and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
